CONCLUSION: Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant is the owner of CARDINAL flats in GPE , which he had respectively let to ORG and PERSON
CARDINAL . In a registered letter of DATE , the applicant informed the tenants that he intended to terminate the lease on expiry of the term on DATE and asked them to vacate the LOC by DATE .
CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenants on DATE , the applicant reiterated his intention to terminate the lease and summoned the tenants to appear before the Rome Magistrate .
CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE , which was made enforceable on DATE , the Rome Magistrate upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant served notice on the tenants requiring them to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , he informed the tenants that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempt to recover possession of the flats which proved unsuccessful , as the applicant was not entitled to police assistance in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . Pursuant to Law no . CARDINAL , on DATE , the applicant addressed himself to ORG in order to be granted the assistance of the police in enforcing the order for possession .

CARDINAL . ORG informed the applicant that priority was given to landlords urgently requiring premises as accommodation for themselves , their spouses , children or ascendants and for seeking priority treatment he should have made a statutory declaration .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the Rome Magistrate set the date of the eviction proceedings for DATE .
CARDINAL . Then , pursuant to Law no . CARDINAL of DATE , the enforcement proceedings were suspended until DATE ; LAW no . FAC suspended them until DATE and LAW no . MONEY suspended them until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant recovered possession of the flat which he had let to ORG
CARDINAL . Pursuant to Law no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE , LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL suspended the enforcement proceedings until DATE .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE , it appears that the applicant has recovered possession of the flat .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice is described in the ORG ’s judgment in the case of ORG ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , ECHR DATE ... ) .
